column4: hey i need help... i just bought a linksys wireless g card. for my lappy...
and i need help installing it...
you got to be careful with wireless devices,  they don't all just work on Linux
some can be tricky to set up, and others  you  might not be able to get working at all,  unless ndiswrapper works which allows the Windows driver to work
sadly not all hardware manufactures support Linux properly or at all
looking at the link the bot gave, that's a start
probably not

to get that wireless working you basically have 3 options.   1.   figure out how to get it working natively if it's possible should be   2.  use Ndiswrapper which I mentioned earlier  3.  try another Linux distro where you may  have more luck with wireless, one comes to mind
can you get a WIndows driver, and the .inf file?
do you know what the repo is by the way?
yes that's what I thought
new to Ubuntu? ended up with it for some reason, but not that technical when it comes to computers? am I correct?
it is, but  sometimes people have to configure wireless
you don't need to know all the commands
infact you hardly need to know any commands,  just  know what commands to put in when it comes to say configuring the wireless
you can get it working
I expect,  just going to have to use the windows driver  with a program called ndiswrapper
with Ndiswraper you will use the  inf file from the Windows driver
so your wireless works good stuff :)
oh
is gone now, and  cabrey did a good job at helping her
